text:
welcome to BBQPitBoys.com today we're cooking up 
a smoked fried Wile E. Coyote approved Road Runner

at the pit and it's real easy to do all right now 
we are told this is Mel Blanc's favorite poultry

dinner for this you'll need some basil you're 
gonna need some sea salt you're gonna need some

curry powder some sugar we got some white pepper 
you're gonna need some five spice and to make it

crispy you need to dry it out you don't want any 
moisture so you take your fancy ass blow later

here of course it's not to be shown on youtube 
right or facebook right can't show you everything

and you dry it you get it real dry that's what 
helps make a crispy bird all right so now we got

the charcoal going indirect and we're adding some 
smoke wood you could use your favorite smoke would

uh you know like apple or you know you can try 
some mesquite whatever and we want to create a lot

of smoke now we're going to take the bird right 
and put them opposite the hot coals and smoke and

get it smoked right perfect now in the meantime we 
got to make some dipping powder so it's easy to do

we're taking some sugar here sea salt curry powder 
some white pepper some five spice into it and uh

this will create a dipping powder and we'll show 
you what you do just let's grind it up nice and

fine and this is real good all right now we've 
been cooking for a while we've gotten to smoke

we're not cooked completely through again we're 
after the smoke and now we're gonna fry it and the

best way to do that was a big walk right because 
this here is a big bird with the neck and all

right in the legs so this allows us to work slowly 
with it slowly dip it into the hot oil be careful

with this of course we don't have to tell you and 
to get it crispy you just ladle that hot oil on

it continuously it won't take long to do maybe a 
few minutes to get it nice and crispy on that side

i'm telling you if you've never had smoked fried 
wiley e coyote approved road runner then you're

missing something out of your life just keep 
ladling that gets it nice crispy like a duck

right like crispy duck you just baste the thickest 
parts on there right you get that even cooking

are you ready all right so we're cooking 
it to an internal temperature in the fry

to about 150 degrees fahrenheit and 
this is when we're gonna wrap it right

this will allow the juices to evenly permeate 
the meat just like that and it won't take long

so while we're waiting let's fry up some basil and 
be careful it splatters all over the place right

so all right now before serving we're going to add 
a little bit more of uh pit boys poultry uh powder

you can definitely check it out if 
you can't use your favorite powder

now this is the part where the pitmaster is going 
to eaten in front of you now take a look at this

i am telling you this is a mel blanc classic 
yet dip it in some of your powder oh good

no joke makes you want to jump 
off a cliff you know what i mean

oh man so you can see it's tender look 
at the skins you can see how crispy it is

this is an outrageous meal you gotta check it 
out now for those coyotes out there who know

this is no road runner you're right this 
is a corn bread fresh chicken so the next

time you're looking for a recipe for 
your pit check out barbecuepitboys.com
